TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void LoadedEventHandler(object sender, LoadedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed LoadedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub LoadedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As LoadedEventArgs)
public delegate void LoadedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, LoadedEventArgs ^ e);
type LoadedEventHandler = delegate of obj * LoadedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of the class. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.LoadedEventHandler> delegate, you identify a method to handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
